moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7: This is a fairly standard look to the Queen's Gambit Declined and there are a number of directions available.
moves.5... O-O 6. Nf3 Nbd7: I always find Nbd7 a difficult move to counter as my dark squared Bishop is now essentially without many good squares and taking the Knight seems wrong.
moves.8. Bxe7: 8. Nxe4 Bxg5 9. Nxg5 Qxg5 10. Nxd7 Bxd7 is also possible and judging by the game continuation probably better
moves.8... Qxe7 9. Bd3: This not much of a threat although and with Black's Queen having open space on my Kingside the eventual castle that I make is probably not such a good idea in any case. I might have been better served with something like 9. Nxe5 dxe5 10. c5
moves.9... Ndf6: Nicely protecting the Knight in that excellent forward position
moves.10. O-O: I think this is a mistake with both Knights on that side of the board and the potential for the Queen to come in at a moments notice
moves.10... Qb4 11. Nxe4 dxe4: Forces my Bishop back and gains a pawn. I think this is better than 11. ... Nxe4 12. b3 even though Black ends up with doubled pawns. The forward e-pawn is not bad at all
moves.12. Be2 Qxb2 13. f3: I'm hoping to clean up that forward e-pawn and open the f-file for my Rook
moves.14. fxe4: I think this is also a mistake. It undoubles the pawns, allows Black's Knight into a strong square although does give me the f-file for my Rook. Better perhaps is 14. Re1 protecting my Bishop and allowing my Queen to get into the game.
moves.16. a4: Retreating the Bishop is perhaps a better move but I wanted to make an active game and perhaps even get a mating attack with something like: 16. ... gxh5 17. Qxh5 Kh8 18. Nxf7+ Kg8 19. Qg4+ Ng5 20. Qxg5# although none of that is forced
moves.16... Qd2: My opponent looks to trade Queens and pick up the Bishop
moves.17. Qf3: Naturally I cannot allow that to happen
moves.17... f5: This removes the potential attack on the f7 pawn
moves.18. Bxg6: Now my Bishop is trapped and I have to make the most of a bad situation
moves.18... Nf6: Immediately capturing the Bishop leads to a bit of a King chase with 18. ... hxg6 19. Nxg6 Rd8 20. Qh5 b6 21. Qh8+ etc or something of the like
moves.19. Bh5: 18. ... Nf6 covers the h5 square and prevents my Queen from coming in on the attack after hxg6 so I have to retreat my Bishop which leads to the loss of several pawns.
moves.19... Nxh5 20. Qxh5 Qxe3+ 21. Kh1 Qxd4 2: I'm down two pawns now although I have a bit of an attack on the unprotected King. I think Black is clearly better at this point and if my opponent can get his Bishop out and activate his Rooks I think it is a winning position.
moves.22... Qg7 23. Ng5: Trying to stay active while down.
moves.23... Qg6: Trying to trade Queens which I must avoid if I'm to have a chance in this game.
moves.24. Qh4 e5 25. Rab1 b6: Preventing my Rook incursion and freeing up the Bishop to move
moves.26. Rbd1 h6 27. Nf3: Backwards I go my activity diminishing by the moment
moves.27... Qf6: This ideally tries to trade the Queens but ends up losing a pawn and I think is a mistake. 27. ... Bb7 is probably better getting the Rooks connected and the Bishop into the game.
moves.30... Bg4 31. Rdc1: Protecting the Queen so as to unpin the Knight
moves.31... Rae8: A blunder although I fail to capitalize. The Knight is no longer pinned.
moves.32. Rce1: Overlooking that reason I moved the Rook to c1 in the first place. Now 32. Nxg4 Qxc3 33. Rxc3 is possible and should have been played
moves.32... Qd6: The blunder that saved the game for me. This forgets that the only thing stopping the Knight from capturing the Bishop was the pin. I think 32. ... Re7 is better preparing to double the attack on the pinned Knight.
moves.33. Nxg4 Rxe1: Now down a piece my opponent trades Rooks which is probably inaccurate.
moves.34. Rxe1 Qd7: Perhaps flustered by previous mistakes my opponent now follows up with a third poor move.
moves.35. Nf6+ Rxf6 36. Qxf6: Now White is in a commanding position and Black must look for Perpetual Check
moves.36... Qg7: The last in a poor series of moves seals the game for me.
moves.37. Re7: At this point Black resigned. I enjoyed this game because I managed to find some good attacks once I fell behind which forced Black to manuever. Eventually I was fortunate when my opponent made a series of poor moves and I was able to get a win.
